meanings.definition: Priced below the actual value or worth.
meanings.sent1: The toy was underpriced, so I bought it for a great deal.
meanings.sent2: The underpriced car sold quickly because it was a bargain.
meanings.sent3: I felt like a savvy shopper when I found the underpriced shoes.
meanings.sent4: The underpriced house was a steal compared to others in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The underpriced painting was a hidden gem in the art gallery.

meanings.definition: To set a price for something lower than its actual value.
meanings.sent1: The store decided to underprice the old stock to clear it out.
meanings.sent2: If you underprice your services, you may not make a profit.
meanings.sent3: The competitor tried to underprice us, but customers still chose quality over price.
meanings.sent4: It's risky to underprice products as it can devalue your brand.
meanings.sent5: The company had to underprice the products to compete with the new market entrants.
